oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Eddy Arnold and his secretary Mary Grizzard, 1959 June 16
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of country music performer and businessman Eddy Arnold with Mrs. Leslie (Mary) Grizzard, his secretary. The photograph appeared in the Nashville Banner newspaper as part of a series of articles about Nashville employers and their secretaries. Mr. Arnold's definition of a secretary was "a loyal, alert and friendly person who wants to be a part of a business." Mrs. Grizzard agreed that "a secretary has to understand the business, have its interests at heart and consider it as your business". Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 3.25 x 4.25 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Arnold, Eddy, 1918- ; Grizzard, Mary
